PURPOSETHE PROPOSED PROJECTS WILL ASSIST THE TRIBE TO DEVELOP, MANAGE, AND PROTECT THEIR WATER AND RELATED RESOURCES, AS AUTHORIZED BY PUBLIC LAW. ALSO, BY MAKING FUNDING AVAILABLE TO THE TRIBE FOR THE PROJECT, RECLAMATION IS HELPING THE TRIBE BECOME MORE SELF-SUFFICIENT AND SUSTAINABLE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTASK 1. TRIBAL WATER MONITORING PROGRAMA TRIBAL WATER MONITORING PLAN WILL BE DEVELOPED BY DESIGNING WATER MONITORING LOCATIONS FOR SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER. THE DESIGN WILL INCLUDE CONSIDERATION OF FLOW REGIME, KNOWN REGIONAL GEOLOGY AND HYDROGEOLOGY, POTENTIAL SYSTEM INPUTS, AND POINTS OF DIVERSION FOR BENEFICIAL USE, BOTH CURRENT AND POTENTIAL FUTURE. ANALYTICAL PARAMETERS WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER AS WELL AS PROVIDE INITIAL SEASONAL WATER QUALITY INFORMATION.SUBTASK 1. UPDATE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROGRAM PLANSUBTASK 2. DEVELOP SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS PLANTASK 2. EQUIPMENT PURCHASES AND INSTALLATIONEQUIPMENT NEEDED FOR THE SAMPLING POINTS INCLUDING HOUSINGS WILL BE PURCHASED, EXISTING WELLS ON THE RESERVATION WILL BE EVALUATED FOR USE (WELLS FOUND TO BE NOT IN USE AND NOT USEABLE FOR THE PROGRAM WILL BE LISTED FOR REMOVAL UNDER FUTURE BIA WATER RESOURCES PROGRAMS), AND SITES AND DRILLERS SELECTED FOR MONITORING WELL INSTALLATION.  TASK 3. WELL REHABILITATION AND INSTALLATIONTHERE ARE THREE MODERN WELLS WITH OPERABLE PUMPS ON THE RESERVATION. BOTH ARE IN USE AND MAY REQUIRE MODIFICATION TO ACCOMMODATE THE EQUIPMENT. IN ADDITION, THERE ARE ONE OR MORE OLDER WELLS THAT ARE NOT IN USE OF UNKNOWN CONDITION AND DESIGN (NO WELLS ON THE RESERVATION HAVE WELL LOGS). AN ATTEMPT WILL BE MADE TO UTILIZE EXISTING WELLS PRIOR TO INSTALLATION OF NEW WELLS FOR EFFICIENT BUDGET MANAGEMENT. IN ADDITION, ANY OF THE UNUSED WELLS DEEMED NOT USEABLE WILL BE ADDED TO THE NEXT YEARS BIA WATER RESOURCES PROGRAM FOR REMOVAL.TASK 4. EQUIPMENT DOWNLOAD AND SAMPLING AND ANALYSISSOLINST LEVELOGGERS HAVE BEEN SUCCESSFULLY USED IN RESERVATION WELLS AND FOR SURFACE WATER MONITORING. THE UNITS DO REQUIRE REGULAR DOWNLOADING AMONG OTHER MAINTENANCE. THIS CAN BE DONE DURING THE QUARTERLY WATER QUALITY MONITORING.TASK 5. REPORTING AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENTREPORTING WILL INCLUDE QUARTERLY AND FINAL REPORTS PLUS REPORTING TO THE TRIBAL COUNCIL. PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING RESULTS OF THE PROGRAM TO BE USED TO UPDATE THE EPA TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN AND ADD TASKS INCLUDING CONTINUED AND OR EXPENDING MONITORING TO SUBSEQUENT EPA AND BIA FUNDED PROGRAMS. THE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES ARE THE USE OF THE RESULTS OF THIS PROGRAM TO BUILD CAPACITY AND CONTINUE ACTIVITIES IN SUBSEQUENT PROGRAMS USING FUNDING FROM OTHER SOURCES.OUTCOMETHE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT TO ESTIMATE NORMAL, SEASONAL FLUCTUATIONS, AND TO QUANTIFY WATER RESOURCES WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO TIMELY AND EFFICIENTLY RESPOND TO DROUGHT. THE EXISTING EPA APPROVED QUALITY ASSURANCE PROGRAM PLAN (QAPP) WILL DIRECT THE STANDARD SAMPLING AND ANALYTICAL PROCESS FOR SURFACE WATER. REVISIONS TO THE QAPP FOR GROUNDWATER ANALYSIS WILL BE DETERMINED AS WATER QUALITY DATA IS COLLECTED FOLLOWING THE INSTALLATION OF MONITORING WELLS. MONITORING WELL INSTALLATION PLANS WILL BE FOLLOWED TO ENSURE THAT INITIAL SAMPLING EFFORTS AND MONITORING PROCEDURES ARE DOCUMENTED. LABORATORY ANALYSIS WILL BE CONDUCTED BY A STATE OR EPA CERTIFIED LABORATORY CAPABLE OF ANALYZING THE SUITE OF CONSTITUENTS IDENTIFIED DURING THE PLANNING PHASE. STATISTICAL ANALYSIS FOR REPORTING OF TREND DATA WILL BE CONDUCTED USING INDUSTRY ACCEPTED STATISTICAL ANALYSIS. THE DATA ANALYSIS WILL ALLOW FOR THE TRIBE TO IDENTIFY ANOMALIES IN THE DATA THAT WOULD REQUIRE ADMINISTRATIVE DECISIONS, INCLUDING EMERGENCY ORDERS, ORDINANCES, OR OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE DIRECTIVES. IN ADDITION, THE MONITORING PROGRAM WILL CATALOG GENERAL WATER QUANTITY AND QUALITY PARAMETERS.BENEFICIARY: THE PUBLIC

PURPOSE:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE TRIBE TO DEVELOP, MANAGE, AND PROTECT THEIR WATER AND RELATED RESOURCES, AS AUTHORIZED BY PUBLIC LAW. ALSO, MAKING FUNDING AVAILABLE TO THE TRIBE FOR THE PROJECT, RECLAMATION IS HELPING THE TRIBE BECOME MORE SELF-SUFFICIENT AND SUSTAINABLE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:TASK 1: INSTALL WATER LEVEL TRANSDUCERS:WATER LEVEL DATALOGGERS WILL BE INSTALLED IN THE TWO TRIBAL WELLS TO AUTOMATICALLY AND CONTINUOUSLY RECORD FLUCTUATIONS IN WATER LEVEL IN THE WELL INCLUDING STATIC AND PUMPING WATER LEVELS TO DETERMINE AQUIFER PERFORMANCE AND BEHAVIOR DURING DROUGHT. WATER LEVEL DATA LOGS WILL BE STORED IN THE DATALOGGER S MEMORY AND WILL BE DOWNLOADED USING SOFTWARE, TO SMART DEVICE APP, TELEMETRY, OR ASSOCIATED DATA ACQUISITION SYSTEM. AN ABSOLUTE WATER LEVEL DATALOGGER WILL BE PREFERRED SINCE IT MEASURES BOTH WATER AND ATMOSPHERIC PRESSURE  THEREFORE WATER LEVEL DATA NEEDS TO BE BAROMETRICALLY COMPENSATED.TASK 2: REHABILITATE EXISTING WATER STORAGE TANK:THE 274,00-GALLON WATER STORAGE IS OLD AND CORRODED WHICH COMPROMISE ITS INTEGRITY AND NEEDS UPGRADES TO CONTINUE SERVING THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY WITH WATER STORAGE FOR DRINKING WATER AND FIRE SUPPRESSION CAPACITY.HIS WILL COMPLETED BY FIRST CLEANING THE INTERIOR WATER STORAGE TANK AND REMOVING SLUDGE THAT HAS ACCUMULATED IN THE TANK. THEN, THE WATER STORAGE TANK WILL BE REHABILITATED. THIS PROCESS INVOLVES CORROSION CONTROL THROUGH CATHODIC PROTECTION AND PLUMBING REPAIRS, COATING, AND PAINTING.EXPECTED OUTCOME(S) DELIVERABLE(S):TASK 1 OUTCOMES:. TWO WATER LEVEL TRANSDUCERS INSTALLED IN THE WATER STORAGE TANKS.TASK 2 OUTCOMES: THE INTERIOR OF THE WATER STORAGE TANK WILL BE SAND BLASTED AND RECEIVE NEW ELASTOMERIC POLYURETHANE COATING. THE EXTERIOR OF THE WATER STORAGE TANK WILL HAVE HARDWARE REPLACED (IF WARRANTED), STEEL AND STRUCTURAL REPAIRS WELDS, AND HE EXTERIOR OVERCOATED WITH EPOXY POLYSILOXANE.BENEFICIARY: THE PUBLIC

THE RECIPIENTS WATER RESOURCES PROGRAM WILL COORDINATE WITH THE U. S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS) TO PROCESS DATA FROM SIX USGS GAGING STATIONS THAT THAT RECIPIENT MONITORS ON TRIBAL LAND. THE DATA WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY IN ADAPTING TO CLIMATE CHANGE.ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS SCOPE INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:TASK ONE. NARRATIVES WILL BE COMPILED FROM VIVIAN HIPPMANN GAUERS MASTERS THESIS: ADAPTIVE CAPACITY CREATION IN THE ST:LO RESEARCH AND RESOURCE MANAGEMENT CENTRE (ST:LO NATION, BC) AND THE FORT APACHE HERITAGE FOUNDATION (WHITE MOUNTAIN APACHE TRIBE, AZ).TASK TWO. USING METEOROLOGICAL, STREAMFLOW GROUNDWATER AND WATER-QUALITY DATA, INCLUDING DATA RECEIVED FROM THE SIX USGS GAGING STATIONS MONITORED BY THE RECIPIENT, DATA WILL BE COLLECTED AND ANALYZED THAT SUPPORTS NARRATIVES IDENTIFIED IN TASK ONE.TASK THREE. A USGS SERIES REPORT AND ACCOMPANYING USGS FACT SHEET WILL BE DEVELOPED. TASK FOUR. THE RECIPIENT WILL COORDINATE AND COMPLETE TRAINING ON LEVERAGING THE DATA GATHERED IN TASK TWO. THE RECIPIENT WILL COORDINATE A PRESENTATION FROM USGS TO TRIBAL MEMBERS AND DOCUMENTS DEVELOPED IN TASK THREE WILL BE USED BY THE RECIPIENT AS OUTREACH MATERIAL TO HELP TRIBAL MEMBERS ADAPT TO CLIMATE CHANGE.

PURPOSE: THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (RECLAMATION), THROUGH THE NATIVE AMERICAN AFFAIRS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TRIBES PROGRAM (PROGRAM), PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIAN TRIBES AND TRIBAL ORGANIZATIONS.THIS PROGRAM IS ADMINISTERED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RECLAMATION ACT OF 1902, AS AMENDED AND SUPPLEMENTED, INCLUDING 43 UNITED STATES CODE (USC) 373D, WHICH AUTHORIZES RECLAMATION TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIAN TRIBES AND TRIBAL ORGANIZATIONS TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES TO DEVELOP, MANAGE, AND PROTECT TRIBAL WATER AND RELATED RESOURCES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT WITHIN THE TWO-YEAR PERIOD PROPOSED THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES ARE ANTICIPATED:A. INSTALLATION OF MONITORING WELL(S) AND IMPROVEMENTS ON EXISTING WELLS USED TO MONITOR RECHARGE AND AQUIFER CHARACTERISTICS.B. MONITORING OF WATER USE AND PERMITTING IN THE WATERSHED TO ESTABLISH WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS.C. ESTABLISH BASELINE WATER QUALITY MONITORING.D. DESIGN AND PERMITTING FOR CRITICAL EROSION CONTROL MEASURESDELIVERABLES: COMPLETED WELLS WITH WATER QUALITY TESTS, AND WELL DEVELOPMENT REPORT, AND PUMP TEST RESULTS.BENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC

THE TRIBE SEEKS TO DEVELOP TRIBAL WATER STORAGE RIGHTS AND IS CURRENTLY INVESTIGATING THE POTENTIAL FOR THE CONVEYANCE OF 5,000 ACRE-FEET OF WATER FROM METROPOLITAN WATER DISTRICT VIA EASTERN MUNICIPAL WATER DISTRICT TURNOUT EM-21 TO A YET TO BE SELECTED DAM SITE LOCATED WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE TRIBES RESERVATION.THIS PROJECT WILL USE A MULTI-PHASE APPROACH TO COMPLETE GEOLOGIC AND GEOTECHNICAL EXPLORATIONS AT A PRIMARY DAM SITE AND ALTERNATIVE DAM SITES. THIS INCLUDES GEOPHYSICAL EXPLORATION TO CONFIRM BASIC FEASIBILITY, CORE DRILLING AND GEOTECHNICAL INVESTIGATIONS TO DETERMINE AVAILABILITY OF BORROW AND FILL MATERIALS AT THE DAM SITE, AND DEVELOPMENT OF A REPORT TO SUMMARIZE FINDINGS.

PURPOSE: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE AS FOLLOWS:-COMPLIANCE NEPA-PIPE ORDER ACQUISITION-PIPE DELIVERY FOR SPUR AND HIGHLINE SITES-HIGHLINE SITE PIPE INSTALLATION-SPUR DROP SITE PIPE INSTALLATION-PIPE DELIVERY FOR MEMORIAL SITE-SPUR DROP PUMP STATION-JACK AND BORES COMPLETION-MEMORIAL SITE PIPE INSTALLATION-MEMORIAL PUMP STATION-COMPLETION OF PHASE 1-COMPLETION OF PHASE 2-FINAL PROJECT REPORTEXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOME IF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE LAYING OF OVER 19 MILES OF NEW RECLAIMED WATER PIPE AND CREATION OF NEW PUMPING STATIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THE UNITED STATES PUBLIC AND THE RECIPIENT ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT WILL CONTRACT FOR THE SITE CLEARING, INSTALLATION OF PIPE, INSTALLATION OF PUMPING STATIONS, EXCAVATIONS, DESIGN COSTS, AND PIPE ACQUISITION.

PURPOSE   FUNDING WILL BE USED TO CONSTRUCT A NEW WATER WELL, REPLACE REVERSE OSMOSIS MEMBRANE FILTERS, INSTALL EFFICIENT IRRIGATION, ADD CARPORTS TO EXISTING BUILDINGS TO HELP PROTECT EQUIPMENT, EPOXY THE FLOORS AND WALLS IN THE TREATMENT PLANT, ADD SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS AND TO TRAIN TRIBAL STAFF. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL HELP THE TRIBE TO BETTER MANAGE THEIR WATER RESOURCES. THE TRIBE HAS ALSO RECEIVED ADDITIONAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FUNDING FOR THE DESIGN OF THEIR FIRE PROTECTION WATER SYSTEM AND STORAGE (R22AP00653). WHEN COMPLETED, STORAGE WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR FIRE SUPPRESSION WHICH IS SEPARATE FROM THE STORAGE OF TREATED DRINKING WATER. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED OBJECTIVE 1  WATER SUPPLY RELIABILITY AND CONSERVATION FROM A REDUCTION IN SEEPAGE. OBJECTIVE 2  REDUCTION OF WATER SYSTEM OPERATING ISSUES AND COSTS. OBJECTIVE 3  INCREASE SELF RELIANCE. EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OUTCOME(S) THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE ABOVE OBJECTIVES WILL HELP THE TRIBE BETTER MANAGED, PROTECT, AND INCREASE RELIABILITY OF TRIBAL WATER SUPPLIES.BENEFICIARY  THE PUBLIC

THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE TRIBE CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE WATER TO THE RESERVATION AND PLAN FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE DEMANDS IN A CHANGING CLIMATE. WATER IS AN ESSENTIAL RESOURCE FOR THE TRIBE AND THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF ITS MEMBERS. AN IMPORTANT COMPONENT OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SECURE A WATER SUPPLY THAT WILL HELP THE TRIBE TO STRENGTHEN ITS RESILIENCY TO DROUGHT THREATS IN ORDER TO PROTECT THE LONG-TERM HEALTH AND SAFETY OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY.  THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP TWO GROUNDWATER WELLS AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE. THE TRIBE CAN USE ITS GROUNDWATER RESOURCES FOR DRINKING WATER, INDUSTRY MUNICIPAL, AND IRRIGATION USES. MAIN OBJECTIVES:5.1 DRILL AND DEVELOP TWO GROUNDWATER WELLS TO APPROXIMATELY 100 FEET AND INSTALL WELL CASING, SUBMERSIBLE PUMP, WELL HEAD MOTOR, ELECTRICITY, WATER METERS, VALVES AND PRESSURE TANK. 5.2 PERFORM WELL TEST AND COLLECT WATER SAMPLES FOR TESTING. 5.3 CONSTRUCT WELL HOUSE TO PROTECT NEW GROUNDWATER WELL EQUIPMENT. 5.4 PREPARATION OF ALL REQUIRED REPORTING.

AWARD PURPOSE: THE LEWISTON ORCHARDS PROJECT (LOP) IS A FEDERAL RECLAMATION PROJECT LOCATED NEAR LEWISTON, IDAHO WITHIN THE LAPWAI CREEK WATERSHED, TRIBUTARY TO THE CLEARWATER RIVER IN THE COLUMBIA RIVER BASIN. THROUGH CONTRACT WITH RECLAMATION, LOID OPERATES AND MAINTAINS THE LOP. THE LOP PROVIDES WATER TO APPROXIMATELY 22,000 PATRONS FOR RESIDENTIAL IRRIGATION PURPOSES WITHIN A 3,828-ACRE SERVICE AREA. THE CURRENT SYSTEM DRAWS WATER FROM CRAIG MOUNTAIN, UTILIZES STORAGE IN WAHA LAKE AND SOLDIERS MEADOW RESERVOIR, AND CONVEYS WATER THROUGH A GRAVITY SYSTEM TO MANN LAKE. THE GRAVITY CONVEYANCE SYSTEM IS PRIMARILY LOCATED ON THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE (TRIBE) RESERVATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PROVIDE FUNDING FOR A TRIBAL STAFF POSITION AS THE PROJECT LEAD TO PERFORM AND ASSIST WITH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:COORDINATION AND PARTICIPATION AS TRIBE S PRIMARY TECHNICAL CONTACT. COORDINATION OF INFORMATION AND DEVELOPING THE LEGISLATION REQUIRED TO TRANSFER NECESSARY TITLES AND WORK WITH THE PARTIES TO SEEK PARTNERS.DEVELOPMENT OF MANAGEMENT AGREEMENTS. ASSIST THE TRIBE AND IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME TO DEVELOP A MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH REGARDS TO RECREATION, FISHING, ETC. FOR RESERVOIR A, SOLDIERS MEADOW RESERVOIR, AND LAKE WAHA. ASSIST THE BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS (BIA) AND LOID TO DEVELOP A MANAGEMENT AND OPERATIONS AGREEMENT FOR THE USE OF RESERVOIR A.PROVIDE ASSISTANCE DURING THE CONSTRUCTION PHASE.PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN DEVELOPING INTERIM OPERATIONS FOR LOID. IMPLEMENTING METHODOLOGY FOR WATER EXCHANGE VALUES. SECURING WATER RIGHTS. EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: RECLAMATION SEEKS TO INCREMENTALLY REPLACE THE CURRENT SURFACE-WATER SYSTEM WITH A MULTI-WELL GROUNDWATER SYSTEM, TO DECOMMISSION THE SURFACE WATER DIVERSION SYSTEM, AND ALLOW FOR THE EXCHANGED SURFACE WATER TO BE PROTECTED INSTREAM. FOLLOWING SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE WATER EXCHANGE PROJECT, RECLAMATION INTENDS TO TRANSFER TITLE OF ITS ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOP TO BIA (TO BE HELD IN TRUST FOR THE TRIBE) AND LOID. THESE MEASURES INCLUDE IMPROVEMENTS THAT SPECIFICALLY BENEFIT THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT TRIBAL CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES, AVOID FUTURE LITIGATION ASSOCIATED WITH FEDERAL-TRIBAL TRUST AND PROPERTY DISPUTES AND IMPACTS TO ESA-LISTED STEELHEAD AND CRITICAL HABITAT, AND INCREASE WATER RELIABILITY FOR LOID PATRONS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N A

ALSO, BY MAKING FUNDING AVAILABLE TO THE TRIBE FOR THE PROJECT, RECLAMATION IS HELPING THE TRIBE BECOME MORE SELF SUFFICIENT AND SUSTAINABLE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED OBJECTIVE 1  EVALUATION OF DECLINING GROUNDWATER LEVELS IN THE WADSWORTH AREAOBJECTIVE 2  EVALUATION OF IMPACTS TO THE TRUCKEE RIVER DOWNSTREAM FROM SPARKS, NEVADAOBJECTIVE 3  TRUCKEE RIVER WATER MANAGEMENT AND RESERVOIR OPERATIONSDELIVERABLES EXPECTED OUTCOME(S) OBJECTIVE 1  THIS PROJECT WILL HELP MITIGATE POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO THE WADSWORTH COMMUNITY WATER SUPPLY AND INCLUDE DATA COLLECTION RELATED TO EVALUATING THE FACTORS EFFECTING THIS CRITICAL GROUNDWATER RESOURCE. THE PROJECT REPRESENTS THE COMPLETION OF THE GROUNDWATER RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT OF THE MESA GRANDE BAND OF MISSION INDIANS (TRIBE). THE PROJECT STARTED IN FY 2020 THROUGH THE BOR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TRIBES PROGRAM. WORK COMPLETED TO DATE HAS INVOLVED THE IDENTIFICATION OF FIVE SITES FAVORABLE FOR DRILLING INTO THE FRACTURED BEDROCK AQUIFER UNDERLYING TRIBAL LANDS, ENVIRONMENTAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES COMPLIANCE FOR DRILL SITES, DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS FOR WELL DRILLING AND COMPLETION, SOLICITATION AND SELECTION OF A DRILLING AND PUMP CONTRACTOR, AND THE DRILLING AND COMPLETION OF WELLS AT TWO OF FIVE SITES. AQUIFER TESTING AND PREPARATION OF PROJECT REPORTS FOR PHASE 1 OF THE PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED BY JUNE 2022.PHASE 2 OF THE PROJECT INVOLVES THE DRILLING AND COMPLETION OF THREE WELLS ON THE REMAINING SITES, ENVIRONMENTAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES COMPLIANCE FOR GRADING ACCESS ROADS TO DRILL SITES, AQUIFER TESTING, DATA COLLECTION AND EVALUATION, AND PREPARATION OF PROJECT REPORTS TO INCLUDE AN ESTIMATE OF THE AQUIFER S SUSTAINABLE YIELD TO MANAGE GROUNDWATER RESOURCES.UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL COMPLETE ALL ACTIVITIES REQUIRED TO DRILL WELLS AT THE THREE REMAINING SITES OF THE FIVE PRE SELECTED DURING PHASE 1 OF THIS PROJECT.THE PROJECT IS LOCATED IN THE MESA GRANDE RESERVATION WITHIN THE 900 ACRE TRACT.

PURPOSE: TO PROVIDE A SOLAR COVER OVER WATER CANALS NEAR CHANDLER, AZ.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: -COMPLIANCE  NEPA-FINAL DESIGN-ORDER LONG-LEAD ITEMS (SOLAR PANELS, SIGNS, DRILLED SHAFTS)-FINAL PROJECT REPORT EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPLETE A SOLAR ARRAY OVER THE TOP LEVEL CANAL NEAR CHANDLER, AZ.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THE UNITED STATES PUBLIC AND THE RECIPIENT ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES. PURPOSE: THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBE (PLPT) WILL BE PROVIDING ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT AND SUPPORT TO THE U.S. BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (RECLAMATION) BANK STABILIZATION PROJECTS THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED ON THE TRUCKEE RIVER THAT WILL BENEFIT WATER QUALITY AND FISH PASSAGE OPERATIONS. RECLAMATION IS PROPOSING TWO PROJECTS, THE MARBLE BLUFF ISLAND REMOVAL PROJECT AND THE UPPER REACH PROJECT THAT REQUIRES EXCAVATION AND REMOVAL OF AN ISLAND IMMEDIATELY UPSTREAM OF MARBLE BLUFF DAM AND FISH PASSAGE FACILITY AND WILL IMPLEMENT BANK STABILIZATION MEASURE FOR APPROXIMATELY 2,000 FEET OF RIVERBANK. THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE PEOPLE HAVE A DEEP CONNECTION WITH THE LISTED FISH SPECIES, THE WELLBEING, AND RECOVERY OF THESE FISH HAS A PROFOUND IMPACT ON THE TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS. THE CULTURE OF THE TRIBE IS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE THAT IS INTRINSICALLY CONNECTED TO THE FISH AND WATER WITHIN THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE RESERVATION. PROVIDING ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT OF RECLAMATION PROJECTS WILL ADDRESS THE PUBLIC PURPOSE STATED IN THE TRIBAL MISSION STATEMENT THE PYRAMID LAKE PAIUTE TRIBAL COUNCIL IS DEDICATED TO CREATING A RESPECTFUL ENVIRONMENT THAT INSPIRES VALUES  PROTECTS AND PRESERVES OUR CULTURAL AND TRADITIONAL HERITAGE  SUPPORTS TRIBAL SELF-SUFFICIENCY  PROMOTES EMOTIONAL AND SPIRITUAL WELLNESS  AND ENCOURAGES INNOVATION AND POSITIVE LEADERSHIP. WE ASPIRE TO ACHIEVE THROUGH TRUSTED COOPERATION, COORDINATION, AND COLLABORATION WITH LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL COMMUNITIES, AND WITH INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS WHO AIM TO ACHIEVE SIMILAR GOALS OF THE TRIBE AND ITS COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:1. PARTICIPATE IN DESIGN OF BANK STABILIZATION MEASURES2. REVIEW ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE DOCUMENTS3. PROVIDE CONSTRUCTION SUPPORT4. DETERMINE REACHES FURTHER UPSTREAM THAT MAY REQUIRE BANK STABLIZATIONEXPECTED OUTCOME(S):1. THE FINAL BANK STABILIZATION MEASURES WILL MEET STANDARDS AS SPECIFIED BY PLPT AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS. 2. PERMITTING AND ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE DOCUMENTS ARE APPROVED, AND THE PROJECT CAN MOVE FORWARD WITH CONSTRUCTION. 3. THE ISLAND REMOVAL AND BANK STABILIZATION MEASURES ARE CONSTRUCTED. 4. FUNDING AFTER PROVIDING ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT OF THE RECLAMATION PROJECTS MAY BE LIMITED, THEREFORE PLPT WILL LIKELY ONLY BE ABLE TO INVENTORY ADDITIONAL REACHES THAT NEED WORK IN THE FUTURE. ADDITIONAL FUNDING AVENUES WILL LIKELY BE REQUIRED TO MOVE FORWARD WITH DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES FOR ANY REACHES IDENTIFIED.BENEFICIARY: THE PUBLIC

BACKGROUND AND OBJECTIVESTHE WICHITA AND AFFILIATED TRIBES (TRIBE) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBE HEADQUARTERED ONE MILE NORTH OF ANADARKO, IN CADDO COUNTY, AND GEOGRAPHICALLY SITUATED IN RURAL SOUTHWEST OKLAHOMA. THE TRIBE PURCHASES AN ESTIMATED 25,596 GALLONS OF WATER EACH YEAR FROM THE CITY OF ANADARKO TO OPERATE THEIR EXISTING COMPLEX IN ANADARKO. THE TRIBE IS ADDING ADDITIONAL HEALTHCARE FACILITIES AND A NEW GREENHOUSE FARMING OPERATION WHICH WILL REQUIRE UP TO 1.16 MILLION GALLONS OF WATER PER YEAR BY THE END OF 2024.THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE INSTALLATION OF A NEW WATER WELL AND WATER DELIVERY SYSTEM AND WILL INCLUDE THE DRILLING AND COMPLETION OF A NEW WATER WELL AND TEST WELL, A WATER STORAGE TANK (STANDPIPE), AND APPROXIMATELY 7,600 LINEAR FEET OF NEW WATERLINE. THESE COMPONENTS WILL BE CONNECTED TO DISTRIBUTION LINES THROUGHOUT THE EXISTING TRIBAL COMPLEX AND ALLOW THE TRIBE TO MAINTAIN COMPLETE CONTROL OVER WATER CONSUMPTION AND DELIVERY THROUGH THE ENTIRE TRIBAL COMPLEX. THE WELL, STANDPIPE, AND NEW WATER DELIVERY LINES ARE REQUIRED COMPONENTS TO THIS AGREEMENT AND TO ENSURING WICHITA WATER INDEPENDENCE BY 2024.

PROJECT ABSTRACT TEMPLATEAWARD PURPOSE  TO INCREASE SURVIVAL OF MIGRATING JUVENILE AND ADULT SALMON AND SUMMER STEELHEAD IN THE UMATILLA RIVER THROUGH COORDINATION OF THE UMATILLA BASIN PROJECT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THREE MAIN AREAS TO ENSURE ADEQUATE PASSAGE CONDITIONS EXIST (1) COORDINATION OF THE LIVE FLOW EXCHANGE COMPONENTS WITH WEST EXTENSION IRRIGATION DISTRICT (WEID), HERMISTON IRRIGATION DISTRICT (HID), AND STANFIELD IRRIGATION DISTRICT (SID) (2) COORDINATION OF FLOW ENHANCEMENT RELEASES FROM MCKAY RESERVOIR, AND (3) MONITORING OF FISH ENHANCEMENT FLOWS. THE PROJECT PROVIDES TECHNICAL INPUT TO RECLAMATION AND CTUIR ON ANY MATTERS RELATED TO THE UMATILLA BASIN PROJECT.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVES      FISH PASSAGE WATER FLOW CONDITIONS DURING THE ADULT AND JUVENILE MIGRATION      PERIODS.ENHANCES      THE MANAGEMENT OF THE EXCHANGE WATER ALLOCATION FOR FISHERIES TO PROVIDE      MAXIMUM BENEFITS FOR FISH PASSAGE RESULTING IN REDUCED MORTALITY RATES. SPOKANE TRIBAL HATCHERY WATER RECIRCULATION PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE  THIS PROJECT WILL DESIGN AND BUILD A WATER REUSE SYSTEM TO ALLOW THE HATCHERY TO REUSE WATER ONCE IT HAS FLOWED THROUGH THE SYSTEM. THE SPOKANE TRIBAL HATCHERY (STH) CURRENTLY HAS ONE OPTION, TO REDUCE PRODUCTION OUTPUT, IF THE AVAILABLE WATER SUPPLY IS INTERRUPTED OR REDUCED. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE HATCHERY TO INCREASE WATER REUSE, DRASTICALLY REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF  NEW  WATER REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN CURRENT PRODUCTION. THE REUSE CAPABILITIES WILL RESULT IN A FACILITY WITH HIGHER RESISTANCE TO DROUGHT IMPACTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  INSTALL INFRASTRUCTURE FOR WATER RECIRCULATION AT STH AND REUSE APPROXIMATELY 1.7 MILLION GALLONS OF WATER PER DAY BY COLLECTING WATER THAT IS FLOWING OUT OF THE RACEWAYS AND PUMPING IT BACK TO THE TOP OF THE SYSTEM FOR REUSE.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  THE INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES TO REUSE WATER AT STH WILL STRENGTHEN TRIBAL WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. THIS WILL BE EVIDENCED BY DECREASING THE AMOUNT OF WATER NEEDED TO MAINTAIN HATCHERY OPERATIONS WHILE ALSO RESULTING IN HEALTHIER FISH THROUGHOUT THE GROWING SEASON. THIS WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT UPON DATE OF AWARD, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF FEBRUARY 28, 2025.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST WITH ADDRESSING FUTURE WATER SHORTAGES AND BUILDING LONG TERM DROUGHT RESILIENCE FOR THE SPOKANE TRIBE OF INDIANS BY ALLOWING FOR WATER RE USE AND REDUCING DEPENDENCY ON  NEW  WATER INPUTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD)  N A

1. AWARD PURPOSE  BIG VALLEY RANCHERIA (TRIBE) RECEIVED GRANT FUNDING FROM THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (BOR) IN THE PAST TO IMPROVE THEIR WATER RESOURCES. THE TRIBE NOW DESIRES TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS TO ITS WATER TREAT PLANT (WTP). THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROJECT WILL ENSURE A RELIABLE SUPPLY OF CLEAN AND HIGH QUALITY DRINKING WATER SOURCES TO THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.THE PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW WATER TREATMENT PLANT WITH CAPACITY TO REDUCE FINISHED WATER CORROSIVITY TO LESSEN THE LEAD AND COPPER TOLERANCE EXCEEDANCES AND HEALTH EXPOSURE. THE WTP IMPROVEMENTS WILL ALSO HELP WITH IRON AND MANGANESE REMOVAL AND IMPROVE THE OVERALL WATER QUALITY SERVED TO BIG VALLEY TRIBAL HOUSING SUBDIVISION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT. AFTER SEVERAL YEARS OF STUDIES, THE TRIBE HAS OBTAINED FUNDING FROM USDA RURAL DEVELOPMENT, INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE (IHS), AND THE EPA TO CONSTRUCT A NEW WATER TREATMENT PLANT SEPARATE FROM THE WASTEWATER FACILITY. BOR IS ALSO PROVIDING FUNDING TO COMPLETE THE WTP.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE TRIBE IDENTIFY AND PLAN FOR THREATS TO THEIR DRINKING WATER SYSTEM. IN ADDITION, THE BACKUP POWER SOURCE WILL ENABLE THE TRIBE TO CONTINUE TO PRODUCE DRINKING WATER DURING PERIODS WHEN POWER IS SHUT OFF DUE TO CLIMATE CHALLENGES. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP THE TRIBE BETTER MANAGE AND PROTECT THEIR WATER RESOURCES.3. EXPECTED DELIVERABLE OR OUTCOME  THE TRIBE WILL CONTRACT TO CONSTRUCT A NEW WTP FACILITY. THIS WTP WILL MEET ALL REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS TO PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY (IES)  THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE TRIBE TO DEVELOP, MANAGE, AND PROTECT THEIR WATER AND RELATED RESOURCES, AS AUTHORIZED BY PUBLIC LAW. ALSO, MAKING FUNDING AVAILABLE TO THE TRIBE FOR THE PROJECT, RECLAMATION IS HELPING THE TRIBE BECOME MORE SELF SUFFICIENT AND SUSTAINABLE.5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS AGREEMENT.

IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA THERE IS INCREASING PRESSURE FROM DROUGHT CONDITIONS AND A CONTINUOUS STRAIN ON WATER RESOURCES FACED IN THE REGION AND BY THE RECIPIENT.IN 2019, THE RECIPIENT FORMED THE AGUA CALIENTE WATER AUTHORITY ( ACWA ), A BRANCH OF TRIBAL GOVERNMENT WHICH REGULATES AND ADMINISTERS THE RECIPIENT S GROUNDWATER UNDERNEATH THE AGUA CALIENTE INDIAN RESERVATION (THE  RESERVATION ). CURRENTLY, ACWA OVERSEES EIGHT PERMITTED GROUNDWATER PRODUCERS, WHO PRODUCE A COMBINED TOTAL OF JUST UNDER 10,000 ACRE FEET OF THE RECIPIENT S GROUNDWATER PER YEAR. ONE HUNDRED PERCENT OF THIS WATER IS USED FOR IRRIGATION, WITH APPROXIMATELY 93  BEING USED ON GOLF COURSES. IN THE COACHELLA VALLEY, SPECIFICALLY IN PROXIMITY TO THE RESERVATION, PER CAPITA WATER USE IS 17  HIGHER THAN IN OTHER REGIONS WITH COMPARABLE CLIMATIC CONDITIONS, LARGELY DUE TO RECREATIONAL AREAS SUCH AS GOLF COURSES. IT IS IMPORTANT THAT THE RECIPIENT PERFORM A STUDY TO PROTECT THE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF THE RECIPIENT S GROUNDWATER FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS, AND TO EXPAND TRIBAL KNOWLEDGE OF HOW ITS WATER IS USED BY GROUNDWATER PERMITTEES. THE STUDY WILL INCREASE THE RECIPIENT S MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES BY DEVELOPING DEMAND REDUCTION MEASURES AND OUTLINING WATER USE EFFICIENCY MEASURES THAT INCLUDE COST BENEFIT ANALYSIS FOR PERMITTED PRODUCERS. AS A RESULT OF THE STUDY, THE RECIPIENT WOULD GAIN A MORE THOROUGH UNDERSTANDING OF HOW AND WHERE THE RECIPIENT S RESOURCES ARE BEING USED AND MAY IMPROVE CONSERVATION MEASURES TO REDUCE PERMITTED PRODUCERS  RELIANCE ON GROUNDWATER RESOURCES AND ENHANCE DROUGHT PREPAREDNESS.THE TRIBE AND THEIR WATER RESOURCES CONSULTANTS, STETSON ENGINEERS, WILL COMPLETE A WATER DEMAND MANAGEMENT MEASURES (WDMM) STUDY.

THE PURPOSE OF THE AGREEMENT IS TO HELP PROTECT AND MAINTAIN IMPORTANT CRITICAL WILDLIFE HABITAT ON THE MUSCOGEE RESERVATION THROUGH RECONSTRUCTION OF A FIVE ACRE POND, AS WELL AS REINTRODUCTION OF NATIVE PLANTS AT DUSTIN FARM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO TRANSFER FUNDING TO FORT BELKNAP TRIBE FOR REVIEW AND EVALUATION OF WATER WELL QUALITY. THE EVALUATION WILL HELP TO DETERMINE IF WELLS ARE PRODUCING AND IF THEY WILL IMPROVE THE TRIBE S ABILITY TO PROTECT TRIBAL RESOURCES AND PROVIDE CLEAN, SAFE WATER.

THE CHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBE HEADQUARTERED INDURANT, OKLAHOMA. THE NATION S JURISDICTION INCLUDES ALL OR PORTIONS OF 13 COUNTIES INSOUTHEAST OKLAHOMA. THE DAISY RANCH INCLUDES 23,500 ACRES AND THE SMALLER TUSKAHOMA RANCH CONTAINS 290 ACRES. THE GOALS OF THE RANCHES ARE TO IMPROVE THE VALUE OF CHOCTAW LANDS PART OF THE NATION S BROADER INITIATIVE TO RECLAIM ITS HOMELAND AND EXPAND ITS AGRICULTURAL HERITAGE AND TO DEVELOP AND SUSTAIN A QUALITY BEEF HERD, INCLUDING ANGUS CATTLE, BUFFALO, AND OTHER CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT LIVESTOCK. THE SIX RANCHES, INCLUDING DAISY AND TUSKAHOMA, CONTAIN APPROXIMATELY 2,100 HEAD OF CATTLE. THE TUSKAHOMA RANCH IS ADJACENT TO THE NATION S CAPITAL GROUNDS.THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ESTABLISH A RELIABLE, LONG TERM LIVESTOCK WATERING SUPPLY AND UTILIZE RECLAMATION FUNDS TO DRILL AND COMPLETE TWO WELLS, ALONG WITH APPURTENANT INFRASTRUCTURE, AT THE NATION S DAISY AND TUSKAHOMA RANCHING OPERATIONS. THE PROJECT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY IN THAT IT WILL RESULT IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND PROTECTION OF TRIBAL WATER RESOURCES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO CHICKASAW NATION FOR THE IRRIGATION EFFICIENCY IMPROVEMENTS AT CHICKASAW CULTURAL CENTER. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL REDUCE WATER USAGE BY INTEGRATING ALL WATER SYSTEMS AND TYING THEM TO A GLOBAL WEATHER STATION, REGULATING WATER NEEDS. WATER REGULATION WILL SAVE OVER 1 MILLION GALLONS OF WATER PER YEAR.CHICKASAW NATION WILL COMPLETE IRRIGATION EFFICIENCY BY INSTALLING CONTROLLER SOFTWARE PANELS, FLOW METERS, A ROADSIDE IRRIGATION SYSTEM, AND STICKBALL FIELD IRRIGATION SYSTEM. THEY WILL ALSO ADD A GLOBAL WEATHER STATION AND CONVERSION VALVES.

AWARD PURPOSE THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE TRIBE CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SAFE AND RELIABLE WATER TO THE RESERVATION AND PLAN FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE DEMANDS IN A CHANGING CLIMATE  WATER IS AN ESSENTIAL RESOURCE FOR THE TRIBE AND THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF ITS MEMBERS  THE TRIBE RELIES FULLY ON ITS GROUNDWATER RESOURCES FOR DRINKING WATER, MUNICIPAL, AND IRRIGATION USES  GROUNDWATER LEVELS IN THE CORNING EAST SUB BASIN HAVE BEEN IN RECENT DECLINE DUE TO DROUGHT, CLIMATE EFFECTS TO SNOWPACK, AND EXTRACTIONS FROM SURROUNDING AGRICULTURAL OPERATORS  AN IMPORTANT COMPONENT OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY WATER CONSERVATION STRATEGIES THAT WILL HELP THE TRIBE TO STRENGTHEN ITS RESILIENCY TO THESE THREATS IN ORDER TO PROTECT THE LONG TERM HEALTH AND SAFETY OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED PROJECT TASKS INCLUDE HISTORIC GROUNDWATER, STREAMFLOW, AND PRECIPITATION TRENDS ON AND OFF THE RESERVATION, DEVELOPING A WATER QUALITY AND QUANTITY MONITORING PLAN, DEVELOPING THRESHOLD INDICATORS FOR THE TRIBE TO MONITOR, CONDUCTING A WATER DEMAND ANALYSIS FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE DEMANDS IN THE FACE OF CLIMATE CHANGE, DEVELOPING WATER CONSERVATION STRATEGIES, AND DEVELOPING A COMPREHENSIVE SUSTAINABLE WATER MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE TRIBE THAT WILL HELP THE TRIBE BE AN ACTIVE PARTNER IN LOCAL WATER PLANNING EFFORTS  THE PLAN AND SUBTASKS ARE ANTICIPATED TO TAKE UP TO 24 MONTHS TO DEVELOP PROJECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES THE PLAN WILL ALIGN WITH LOCAL GROUNDWATER SUSTAINABILITY PLANS AND HELP TO PROTECT THE LOCAL GROUNDWATER AQUIFER  BY IMPROVING OVERALL WATER RESILIENCY ON THE RESERVATION, OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS CAN ALSO BE ACHIEVED  LUC LAKE, WHICH CAN BE USED FOR IRRIGATION OR EMERGENCY USE, PROVIDES HABITAT FOR PLANTS AND WILDLIFE  HAVING AN INTEGRATED WATER MANAGEMENT APPROACH THAT ALLEVIATES RELIANCE ON THIS RESOURCE FOR CONSUMPTIVE USES WILL IN TURN LEAD TO THE PROTECTION AND ENHANCEMENT FOR OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES ON THE RESERVATION INTENDED BENEFICIARIES THE BENEFITS OF PROJECT ARE TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES AND GUIDANCE TO HELP TRIBAL DECISIONS ON WATER USAGE, CONSERVATION PRACTICES, AND OTHER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT CRITERIA  THE ASSESSMENT OF TRIBAL AND REGIONAL WATER SUPPLIES WILL INFORM MONITORING AND ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT PLANS THAT DOCUMENT SUSTAINABILITY INDICATORS AND MONITORING THRESHOLDS  THIS MONITORING DATA WILL SUPPORT DECISION MAKING FOR WHEN TO IMPLEMENT INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AND CONSERVATION MEASURES SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD   N A

THE HOPI VILLAGE OF OLD ORAIBI  ORAYVI  IS CONSIDERED THE OLDEST CONTINUOUSLY INHABITED SETTLEMENT IN NORTH AMERICA  HOPI TRIBAL MEMBERS LIVING IN ORAYVI DO NOT HAVE PIPED WATER AND SEWER TO THEIR HOMES  MOST HOMES DO NOT HAVE ELECTRICITY, AND 72 OF 77 HOMES IN ORAYVI LACK ANY TYPE WATER AND SEWER FACILITIES  RESIDENT S HAUL WATER FROM A SPIGOT AT THE HOPI VETERANS MEMORIAL CENTER  HVMC  LOCATED OVER 5 MILES AWAY FROM THE VILLAGE USING A VARIETY OF CONTAINERS  RESIDENTS ARE LIMITED IN THEIR CAPACITY TO HAUL WATER AS MANY ARE ELDERS AND OTHERS DO NOT HAVE TRUCKS AND WATER TRAILERS  IN 2020, THE ORAVYI VILLAGE BOARD  BOARD  WAS SUCCESSFUL IN SECURING CARES FUNDS TO SUBCONTRACT WITH HOPI UTILITIES CORPORATION  HUC  TO DRILL A WELL FOR THE COMMUNITY  TODAY, THE WATER IS NOT RATED SAFE DRINKING WATER BY EPA STANDARDS  INDIAN HEALTH SERVICES  IHS  HAS SUBMITTED AN APPLICATION TO IHS HEADQUARTERS TO SECURE ARPA FUNDS, AND IF AWARDED, THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO BEGIN THE PLANNING PROCESS TO INSTALL A CHLORINATION SYSTEM, A PERMANENT TANK, A WASHETERIA AND A LAGOON  ALTHOUGH THE WELL DRILLING WAS COMPLETED, IT DID NOT PROVIDE A WATER TANK, WATER LINES NOR A SPIGOT  ONCE AGAIN, THE BOARD SECURED ADDITIONAL CARES FUNDS TO INSTALL A THREE PHASE GENERATOR, PROPANE TANK, AND TEMPORARY WATER TANK TO PUMP WATER FROM THE WELL  VILLAGE SECURITY ROUTINELY TURN ON AND OFF THE GENERATOR TO FILL THE TEMPORARY WATER TANK THAT IS BEING USED BY OUR LOCAL RANCHERS AND FARMERS  THE EXISTENCE OF THIS NEW WATER SOURCE HAS BEEN A RESOURCE TO LOCAL FARMERS AND RANCHERS  HOWEVER, THE CONSTANT NEED TO TURN ON AND OFF THE GENERATORS HAS TAKEN A TOLL ON SECURITY STAFF DURING THE EXTREME HEAT  AT TIMES THE BATTERY GOES DEAD, AND THE BATTERY HAS TO BE RECHARGED OR JUMPED TO START THE GENERATOR  THIS TASK WILL BECOME MORE BURDENSOME FOR SECURITY ONCE WINTER ARRIVES  AS A RESULT, A RELIABLE THREE PHASE POWER SOURCE IS WILL BE BUILT AND CONNECTED TO THE WELL  UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL UPGRADE 1 5 TO 2 MILES OF EXISTING POWER INFRASTRUCTURE TO THREE PHASE POWER  THE RECIPIENT WILL THEN EXTEND A NEW LINE TO THE WELL SITE, INSTALL A METER BOX AND A POWER POLE AT THE WELL SITE, AND TIE THIS NEW POWER LINE TO THE CLOSEST EXISTING THREE PHASE POWER SOURCE  THE PROJECT IS LOCATED IN THE OLD ORAIBI COMMUNITY IN NAVAJO COUNTY, ARIZONA WITHIN THE HOPI RESERVATION

THE CHEMEHUEVI INDIAN TRIBE RESIDES ON A RESERVATION THAT IS IN THE MOHAVE DESERT AREA  THE 22 YEAR DROUGHT TAKING PLACE IN THE SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES HAS EXACERBATED THE NORMALLY WATER SPARSE CONDITIONS OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY  AT THE PRESENT TIME THE TRIBE HAS ACCESS TO A NATURAL AQUIFER AS ITS SOLE SOURCE OF POTABLE WATER  THIS AQUIFER IS RECHARGED FROM THE COLORADO RIVER ACCOUNTING SURFACE THE POTABLE WATER SYSTEM ON THE RESERVATION NOT ONLY SERVICES THE TRIBAL HOUSING AND ADMINISTRATIVE AREAS BUT INCLUDES THE BUSINESS DISTRICT AND A LARGE PORTION OF THE UNINCORPORATED TOWN OF HAVASU LANDING THE TRIBE HAS DEVELOPED A WASTEWATER MANAGEMENT MASTER PLAN THAT CALLS FOR ALL WASTEWATER TO BE ROUTED TO RETENTION PONDS FOR REDUCTION OF SOLIDS  THE PRIMARY PURPOSE IS TO ELIMINATE ANY SEPTIC SYSTEMS ON THE RESERVATION TO PROTECT THE AQUIFER FROM INFILTRATION BY WASTEWATER  THE SOIL IN THIS AREA IS NOTED TO BE EXCESSIVELY DRAINED BY PERK TESTS CONDUCTED THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION  ANY UNCONTAINED WASTEWATER CAN EASILY PENETRATE TO THE AQUIFER DEPTH WITH CONTINUED USE OF SEPTIC SYSTEMS  INFILTRATION OF THE MAIN AQUIFER WOULD PROVE CATASTROPHIC FOR ALL THE INHABITANTS OF THIS SMALL LAKESIDE COMMUNITY THIS PROJECT WOULD EXTEND EXISTING WASTEWATER LINES TO THE TRIBAL EPA AND FARM BUILDINGS TO ELIMINATE THE USE OF AN UNDERGROUND SEPTIC AND LEECH LINE SYSTEMS

THE FORT MOJAVE INDIAN TRIBE OPERATES FARMING LANDS ON ITS RESERVATION ALONG THE COLORADO RIVER BETWEEN NEEDLES, CALIFORNIA AND BULLHEAD CITY, ARIZONA IN AN AREA KNOWN AS THE MOHAVE VALLEY  THE AVI KWA AME FARMS, FOUNDED IN 1986, CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 15,000 ACRES GROWING UPLAND COTTON, WHEAT, AND BERMUDA SEED  BY FAR, THE MAJOR SOURCE OF WATER IN THE MOHAVE VALLEY IS THE COLORADO RIVER  THE TRIBE HAS DECREED WATER RIGHTS FROM THE RIVER CONSISTING OF 103,535 ACRE FEET IN ARIZONA, 16,720 ACRE FEET IN CALIFORNIA AND 12,534 ACRE FEET IN NEVADA THE FORT MOJAVE INDIAN TRIBE RESERVATION CONSISTS OF 41,884 ACRES OF LAND SITUATED WITHIN THE MOHAVE VALLEY ALONG THE COLORADO RIVER IN THE TRI STATE AREA OF ARIZONA, CALIFORNIA AND NEVADA  THE AVERAGE TEMPERATURE ALONG THIS PART OF THE COLORADO RIVER IS 110 DEGREES IN THE SUMMER AND 86 DEGREES IN THE WINTER  NEEDLES RECEIVES ABOUT 5 1 2 INCHES OF RAIN PER YEAR DUE TO A CONTINUING DROUGHT IN THE WESTERN UNITED STATES, THE COLORADO RIVER AND ITS ASSOCIATED DAMS AND LAKES ARE AT RECORD LOWS AND THE EXISTING AGRICULTURE WATER PUMPING SYSTEM MUST BE MODIFIED TO CONTINUE TO DIVERT WATER FROM THE COLORADO RIVER TO IRRIGATE FARMLANDS IN THE MOHAVE VALLEY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL CONSTRUCT AND INSTALL A NEW IRRIGATION PUMPING STATION ALONG THE LOWER COLORADO RIVER TO REPLACE THE EXISTING FACILITY

THE RECIPIENT S WE KO PA GOLF CLUB IS COMPRISED OF TWO 18 HOLE COURSES  SAGUARO AND CHOLLA  THE SAGUARO COURSE OPENED IN 2006  SURFACE WATER FROM THE VERDE RIVER IS WITHDRAWN FROM THREE SHALLOW WELLS AND MOVED TO A CENTRAL DISTRIBUTION HUB THAT CAN PROVIDE WATER TO BOTH COURSES  THE VERDE RIVER IS LESS THAN ONE MILE EAST OF THE GOLF COURSES AND SURFACE WATER IS AVAILABLE TO THE RECIPIENT PURSUANT TO THE FORT MCDOWELL INDIAN COMMUNITY WATER SETTLEMENT  1993   FROM THE HUB, WATER IS DIRECTED TO ONE OF THREE LAKES  TWO OF THE LAKES ARE UTILIZED TO HOLD IRRIGATION WATER AND THE PUMP STATION ON THE SAGUARO COURSE IS LOCATED BY THE LAKE  THE PUMP STATION PUMPS THE WATER FROM THE LAKE INTO THE PHYSICAL IRRIGATION SPRINKLER SYSTEM  ON SEPTEMBER 22, 2021, WATERTRONICS COMPLETED AN ASSESSMENT OF THE SAGUARO COURSE PUMP STATION AND DETERMINED THAT THE STATION, ALTHOUGH OPERATIONAL, WAS IN FAIR TO POOR CONDITION  TWO CAUSES FOR THIS RATING WERE AGE AND WATER DAMAGE CAUSED BY THE LEAKING STUFFING BOX SEALS ON THE PUMP HEADS THE SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS OF THE RECIPIENT S WATER SETTLEMENT IMPOSE SOME WATER MANAGEMENT LIMITATIONS DURING THE HOT SUMMER MONTHS WHEN WATER DEMAND FOR BOTH AGRICULTURE AND THE GOLF COURSES IS HIGHEST  IN 2020, THE HOT AND DRY SUMMER CONDITIONS RESULTED IN THE RECIPIENT HAVING SEVERAL MONTHLY EXCEEDANCES OF WATER SETTLEMENT PARAMETERS THAT REQUIRED PAYBACK OF WATER IN 2021  THEREFORE, IT IS CRITICAL THAT THE RECIPIENT OPTIMIZE WATER EFFICIENCY IN ALL OF ITS HIGH WATER USE INDUSTRIES, PARTICULARLY IN LIGHT OF CLIMATE CHANGE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL REPLACE THE EXISTING MAIN IRRIGATION PUMP STATION WITH A SIMILAR BUT MORE ADVANCED IRRIGATION PUMP STATION TO INCREASE WATER EFFICIENCY AND IMPROVED MONITORING THE PROJECT IS LOCATED ON THE SAGUARO GOLF COURSE WITHIN THE WE KO PA GOLF CLUB OF THE FORT MCDOWELL YAVAPAI NATION

PHASE 1 DROUGHT RESPONSE PLANNING AND WATER BUDGET DATA ACQUISITION IN THE WALLA WALLA BASINPROJECT ABSTRACT TEMPLATEAWARD PURPOSE: THROUGH THIS PROJECT, THE RECIPIENT WILL PLAY A CRITICAL ROLE IN ANALYZING AND IDENTIFYING FACTORS ASSOCIATED WITH DROUGHT, LIKE EARLY WARNING SIGNS, AND HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF RECENT TRENDS IN HYDROLOGICAL PROCESSES THAT CAN POTENTIALLY BUFFER CONDITIONS FOR FISHERIES AND ECOSYSTEMS. THE RESULTS FROM THESE ANALYSES CAN BE USED DURING THE LATER STAGES OF DROUGHT PLANNING - WHICH WILL INVOLVE DELIBERATIONS AMONG DIVERSE USER GROUPS TO AGREE ON A PLAN OF ACTION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 1) DROUGHT ANALYSIS AND PLANNING:THIS ACTIVITY WILL EXAMINE RECENT TRENDS IN THE HYDROGRAPH, WATER AVAILABILITY, AND SEASONAL PATTERNS, AND WILL EXAMINE THE UTILITY OF SEVERAL VARIABLES THAT MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE PROBABILITY OF DROUGHT FROM THE HISTORIC RECORD.2) DATA COLLECTION TO SUPPORT INTER-STATE STUDY ON WATER BUDGET: A. CONTINUE INDEPENDENT MEASUREMENT AT GAGE SITES IN THE BASIN B. MEASURE WATER RETURNS IN THE LOWER LITTLE WALLA WALLA C. INSTALL SHORT-TERM GAGE STATIONS (BUBBLER, LOGGER, STAFF) SUCH AS PINE, BIRCH, AND COTTONWOOD CREEKS  (LOCATIONS WILL BE DEPENDENT ON COOPERATOR ACTIVITIES AND DATA NEEDS)3) TRAINING:THIS ACTIVITY REQUESTS FUNDING TO TRAIN TRIBAL STAFF IN FEDERAL PROTOCOLS TO MANAGE AND MEASURE SURFACE WATER AND EXAMINE GROUNDWATER-SURFACE WATER INTERACTIONS.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL ADVANCE THE TRIBE'S WATER PLANNING AND DROUGHT MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES IN THE WALLA WALLA BASIN. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL DIRECTLY INFORM TRIBAL REPRESENTATIVES DOING WATER PLANNING IN THE WALLA WALLA WATER 2050 PROCESS BY PROVIDING INFORMATION TO PLAN FOR DROUGHT EMERGENCY AND IDENTIFY MITIGATING STRATEGIES. THIS WORK WILL BE CARRIED OUT STARTING AUGUST 1, 2022, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF JULY 31, 2025.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE RECIPIENT TO ASSIST THEIR PARTNER CO-MANAGEMENT AGENCIES WITH COMPLEMENTARY HYDROLOGICAL ANALYSIS IN THE WALLA WALLA BASIN DURING THE PLANNING PHASES OF FUTURE WATER DEVELOPMENT. THE WORK WILL AID IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF BYPASS STREAM FLOWS AND IS CRITICAL TO INFORMING DISCUSSIONS ABOUT DROUGHT RELIEF PLANNING AND PROTECTING MINIMUM INSTREAM FLOWS WHEN IT IS MOST CRITICAL TO FISHERIES POPULATIONS. FLOATING TREATMENT WETLAND INSTALLATION PROJECT ABSTRACT TEMPLATEAWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE FOR THIS PROJECT IS TO INSTALL A FLOATING TREATMENT WETLAND (FTW) TO ALLOW SNOQUALMIE TRIBE TO MAINTAIN THE STORMWATER POND AND SIMULTANEOUSLY REDUCE WATER TEMPERATURE, MANAGE WATERSHED NUTRIENTS, AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION, RESULTING IN IMPROVED WATER QUALITY TO DOWNSTREAM CREEKS, AND THE SNOQUALMIE RIVER.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SNOQUALMIE TRIBE WILL INSTALL THE FTW DURING THE 2023-2024 PACIFIC NORTHWEST PLANTING SEASON (OCTOBER 2023-MARCH 2024). AN RFP WILL BE SENT OUT TO GET THE MOST COMPETITIVE PRICE FOR MANUFACTURING AND DELIVERING THE FTW RAFT STRUCTURE TO THE SNOQUALMIE RESERVATION. PLANTS WILL BE SELECTED BY THE PROJECT MANAGER AND THE NATIVE PLANT SPECIALIST, WITH INPUT FROM THE FTW MANUFACTURER AND LOCAL NURSERIES. PLANT SPECIES WILL INCLUDE NATIVE AQUATIC AND EMERGENT WETLAND SPECIES, INCLUDING GRASSES, RUSHES, SEDGES, AND A FEW SMALL WOODY SHRUBS AND/OR HERBACEOUS PLANTS.ONCE THE FTW INSTALLATION IS FINISHED, A SIGN WILL BE INSTALLED BY THE SNOQUALMIE TRIBE FACILITIES STAFF NEAR THE FTW. THE SIGN WILL INCLUDE INFORMATION ON THE WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT BENEFITS OF FTWS. IT WILL ALSO INCLUDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE PLANS USED AND WHETHER ANY OF THEM ARE CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT TO THE SNOQUALMIE TRIBE.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:THE INSTALLATION OF THE FTW WILL ALLOW SNOQUALMIE TRIBE TO MAINTAIN THE STORMWATER POND AND SIMULTANEOUSLY REDUCE WATER TEMPERATURE, MANAGE WATERSHED NUTRIENTS, AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION, RESULTING IN IMPROVED WATER QUALITY TO DOWNSTREAM CREEKS, AND THE SNOQUALMIE RIVER. THE WORK FOR THIS PROJECT WILL OCCUR ONCE THE FUNDS ARE AUTHORIZED WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF DECEMBER 31, 2024.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE PROTECTION OF TRIBAL WATERS BY IMPROVING WATER QUALITY ON THE SNOQUALMIE RESERVATION. THE TRIBE SEES THIS PROJECT AS AN OPPORTUNITY TO EDUCATE OTHERS ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF WETLAND PLANTS TO THE SNOQUALMIE TRIBE, AND WHAT BENEFITS THEY PROVIDE TO PEOPLE, ANIMALS, AND THE ENVIRONMENT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN IS EXPERIENCING ITS 22ND YEAR OF DROUGHT AND EARLIER THIS SUMMER, THE RESERVOIRS HIT THEIR LOWEST LEVELS SINCE THEY WERE ORIGINALLY FILLED. THE TOTAL COLORADO RIVER SYSTEM WATER STORAGE TODAY IS THIRTY-NINE PERCENT OF CAPACITY -- DOWN FROM FORTY-NINE PERCENT AT THIS TIME LAST YEAR. IN 2022, THE LOWER BASIN WILL OPERATE UNDER A LEVEL 1 SHORTAGE CONDITION FOR THE FIRST TIME, WHICH WILL TRIGGER ADDITIONAL REDUCTIONS AND WATER SAVING CONTRIBUTIONS FOR ARIZONA, NEVADA, AND MEXICO.THIS PROJECT INVOLVES THE INSTALLATION OF FLOW MEASUREMENT DEVICES AT TWELVE SITES. SUCH IMPROVEMENTS WILL CONSERVE WATER THROUGH IMPROVEMENTS IN CONVEYANCE AND ON-FARM EFFICIENCIES, AND INCENTIVES TO ENCOURAGE AGRICULTURAL LAND LESSEES TO CONSERVE WATER. THIS REAL-TIME FLOW MEASUREMENT DATA WILL ALSO IMPROVE OPERATIONAL DECISION MAKING TO INCREASE CONVEYANCE EFFICIENCIES AND REDUCE SPILLS. SUCH IMPROVEMENTS ARE CRITICAL GIVEN THE UNPRECEDENTED DROUGHT AND WATER SHORTAGES OCCURRING IN THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN.UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL INSTALL FLOW MEASUREMENT DEVICES AT 11 SITES ON THE INDIAN UNIT OF THE YUMA PROJECT RESERVATION DIVISION (YPRD) AND ONE SITE ON TRIBAL LAND OUTSIDE OF THE YPRD.EACH INSTALLATION WILL PROVIDE THE RECIPIENT WITH REAL-TIME FLOW MEASUREMENT DATA THAT IS CRITICAL FOR THE RECIPIENT TO RESPOND TO DROUGHT CONDITIONS WITH DATA-DRIVEN DECISION MAKING TO IMPROVE THE RECIPIENT'S USE OF WATER RESOURCES.

THE BAR FOUR WELL WAS CONSTRUCTED AND TESTED IN 1996 BY THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS). IT WAS EQUIPPED WITH A PUMP JACK IN 2001 WITH THE UNITED STATES BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (USBR) FUNDS TO PROVIDE WATER FOR THE PROPOSED BAR FOUR DEVELOPMENT TO RELIEVE OVERCROWDING IN THE SUPAI VILLAGE. IN 2016 THE WELL AND PUMP WERE REFURBISHED, A PERMANENT POWER SUPPLY WAS INSTALLED, AND WATER QUALITY SAMPLES WERE OBTAINED AND TESTED USING USBR FUNDS. WATER QUALITY SAMPLES REVEALED THE NEED FOR A WATER TREATMENT SYSTEM TO REMOVE EXCESSIVE IRON, SULFATE, METALS, AND RADIONUCLIDES TO MEET UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (USEPA) STANDARDS UNDER THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT. CONSTRUCTION OF A WATER TREATMENT FACILITY CAPABLE OF PROVIDING WATER TO THE BAR FOUR DEVELOPMENT THAT MEETS THE STANDARDS OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT IS ESTIMATED TO COST APPROXIMATELY $588,000. COMPLETION OF THE BAR FOUR WATER TREATMENT FACILITY IS BROKEN INTO TWO PHASES WITH PHASE I BEING THE FOCUS OF THIS AWARD. PHASE 2 WILL INCLUDE EXCAVATION AND INSTALLATION OF LINERS FOR ADDITIONAL WATER STORAGE. COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL HELP PROVIDE A SECURE WATER SUPPLY FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND PROVIDE A STEP TOWARDS THE COMPLETION OF THE BAR FOUR DEVELOPMENT.UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL CONSTRUCT A WATER TREATMENT BUILDING AND INSTALL A COMMUNITY WATER TREATMENT SYSTEM WITHIN THE WATER TREATMENT BUILDING. A WATER STORAGE TANK AND PUMP SHALL BE INSTALLED AS A PART OF THE FACILITY TO HELP INCREASE DROUGHT RESILIENCY.

ASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIMITED      TRIBAL NEGOTIATION POSITIONS FOR POTENTIAL WATER RIGHTS SETTLEMENT: PROVIDE SUPPORT TO TRIBAL LEGAL/TECHNICAL       STAFF. PARTICIPATE IN LEGAL/TECHNICAL       CALLS/MEETINGS ON AN AS-NEEDED BASIS TO DISCUSS WORK PRODUCT. EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL HELP THE TRIBE WITH SETTLEMENT NEGOTIATIONS THAT WOULD HONOR CLAIMED ON-RESERVATION RIGHTS (INCLUDING ALLOWING FOR A MULTI-USE CONSUMPTIVE RIGHT) AND WOULD INCLUDE SOME STATE-LAW BASED OFF-RESERVATION INSTREAM FLOWS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL HELP THE TRIBE WITH SETTLEMENT NEGOTIATIONS THAT WOULD HONOR CLAIMED ON-RESERVATION RIGHTS (INCLUDING ALLOWING FOR A MULTI-USE CONSUMPTIVE RIGHT) AND WOULD INCLUDE SOME STATE-LAW BASED OFF-RESERVATION INSTREAM FLOWS. AWARD PURPOSE:THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TOOLS AND A NEW DROUGHT PLAN FOR REFERENCE THAT WILL ALLOW TRIBAL DECISION MAKERS TO ACT QUICKLY AND APPROPRIATELY TO DROUGHT CONDITIONSACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:INFORMATION GATHERING AND      COORDINATION WITH DEPARTMENTS: INVENTORYING THE RESOURCES OF CONCERN ON      THE FORT HALL RESERVATION. IMPORTANT RESOURCES AND HOW THEY ARE AFFECTED      BY PRECIPITATION, STREAMFLOW, OR OTHER WATER SOURCES WILL BE INVESTIGATED.DEVELOPMENT      OF SPECIFIC DROUGHT INDICATORS FOR KEY RESERVATION WATER RESOURCES:      ANALYSIS OF DATA GATHERED IN TASK 1. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS ANALYSIS WILL      BE TO DEVELOP WAYS TO QUANTIFY SPECIFIC DROUGHT THREAT TO IRRIGATION AND      OTHER RESOURCES OR ACTIVITIES. A SOFTWARE TOOL WILL BE DEVELOPED TO      PROVIDE EASY USE OF THE DEVELOPED METHODS FOR IDENTIFYING DROUGHT.PROPOSAL      AND ANALYSIS OF DROUGHT MITIGATION ACTIONS IN DROUGHT SCENARIOS: THIS      ACTIVITY WILL INVOLVE ANALYSIS OF IMPACTS OF DROUGHT SHORTFALLS AND      MITIGATION ACTIONS RELATIVE TO ONE ANOTHER. MITIGATION ACTIONS WILL ALSO      BE CONSIDERED BY OTHER QUALITIES IN DISCUSSION WITH DEPARTMENTS TO PROVIDE      PRIORITY RANKINGS AND GUIDANCE FOR SITUATIONS WHEN EACH IS APPROPRIATE.WRITING      FINDINGS AND TRAINING TRIBAL STAFF IN DROUGHT INDICATOR AND MITIGATION      ANALYSIS TOOLS: THIS TASK WILL INVOLVE WRITING ACCOMPANYING MATERIALS TO      SOFTWARE TOOLS DEVELOPED IN THE PREVIOUS TASKS. THIS TASK MAY ALSO INVOLVE      PRESENTING TO TRIBAL MEMBERS AND TRAINING AND SUPPORTING TRIBAL MEMBERS IN      LEARNING TO USE AND MAINTAIN THE TOOLS AND METHODS DEVELOPED TO SUPPORT      THE NEW DROUGHT PLAN.WRITING      OF DROUGHT CONTINGENCY PLAN: THIS WILL INVOLVE DRAFTING OF A CONTINGENCY      PLAN TO PROVIDE AN EFFECTIVE REFERENCE TO DECISION MAKERS ON MONITORING      AND RESPONSES TO DROUGHT.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT WILL:DRAFT A NEW DROUGHT CONTINGENCY PLAN FOR THE SHOSHONE-BANNOCK TRIBES OF FORT HALL. THE NEW PLAN WILL BE DRAFTED TO SUIT THE TRIBES' CURRENT NEEDS AS WELL AS INCORPORATING NEW INFORMATION AND CAPACITY BUILT SINCE THE CURRENT DROUGHT PLAN WAS WRITTEN. THE NEW DROUGHT PLAN DEVELOPED BY THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SPECIFIC METHODS TO IDENTIFY DROUGHT SEVERITY AND ASSOCIATED RISKS THAT ARE SPECIFIC TO THE TRIBES' WATER AND RELATED RESOURCES. THE NEW PLAN WILL ALSO PROVIDE SPECIFIC GUIDANCE ON DROUGHT MITIGATION ACTIONS AND THE EXTENT OF ACTION REQUIRED IN VARIOUS DROUGHT SCENARIOS. A SOFTWARE TOOL OR TOOLS WILL ACCOMPANY THE PLAN TO AID IN IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DEVELOPED DROUGHT RISK RECOGNITION AND MITIGATION ACTION EVALUATION. THIS WORK WOULD BE CARRIED OUT DURING JUNE OF 2022 WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF DECEMBER 31, 2023.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WOULD BENEFIT THE TRIBES BY INCREASING PREPAREDNESS AND HELPING TO MITIGATE THE NEGATIVE IMPACTS OF FUTURE DROUGHT. THE NEW SHOSHONE-BANNOCK TRIBES DROUGHT CONTINGENCY PLAN OVERHAUL DROUGHT PLAN TO BE DRAFTED UNDER THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A VALUABLE REFERENCE TO THE TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS TO ALLOW TIMELY AND OPTIMAL MITIGATION ACTIONS TO BE TAKEN IN RESPONSE TO FUTURE DROUGHT CONDITIONS. THIS WILL HELP THE TRIBES PROTECT THEIR WATER RESOURCES, LIMIT ECONOMIC DAMAGE, AND PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT AND WILDLIFE ON THE FORT HALL RESERVATION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

WATER STORAGE TANK RE-COATING PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE: THE SHOSHONE-BANNOCK TRIBES COMMUNITY WATER SYSTEM SERVES AN AREA OF 28.4 SQUARE MILES AND SERVES RESIDENTIAL, COMMERCIAL, AND INSTITUTIONAL CUSTOMERS WITH A COMBINED 1,108 EQUIVALENT DWELLING UNITS. AN INSPECTION HAS IDENTIFIED THAT THE STORAGE STRUCTURES WERE MOSTLY IN GOOD CONDITION, HOWEVER THEY ALL HAD SOME LEVEL OF CORROSION FROM COATING FAILURE. DUE TO THIS, THE TRIBE HAS IDENTIFIED THE NEED TO COMPLETE THE BLAST AND PAINT FOR THE INTERIOR/EXTERIOR OF THE SHEEPSKIN RESERVOIR.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:UTILIZE AN APPROPRIATELY LICENSED AND QUALIFIED CONTRACTOR TO COMPLETE THE WATER STORAGE TANK RE-COATING. THE CONTRACTOR WILL BLAST AND PAINT THE INTERIOR/EXTERIOR OF THE SHEEPSKIN RESERVOIR.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL RE-COAT THE SHEEPSKIN RESERVOIR STRUCTURE. THIS WORK WOULD BE CARRIED OUT DURING JULY OF 2022 WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF OCTOBER OF 2022.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE TRIBES BY ACTING TO INCREASE THE RELIABILITY OF THE COMMUNITY WATER SYSTEM. THE PROJECT WILL EXTEND THE LIFE AND AID IN PROVIDING FULL AND UNINTERRUPTED FUNCTIONING OF THE WATER DELIVERY SYSTEM. IN ADDITION, TAKING CARE OF THESE REFURBISHMENTS NOW WILL FREE UP THE TRIBES IN THE FUTURE TO USE THEIR CAPACITY FOR OTHER FURTHER DEVELOPMENT IN THE COMMUNITY WATER SYSTEM TO ADDRESS POPULATION GROWTH AND POTENTIAL DROUGHT IMPACTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD):N/A

WATER SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT ABSTRACTAWARD PURPOSE: THE PROPOSED PROJECT INTENT IS TO STRENGTHEN AND CREATE A MORE RESILIENT DRINKING WATER SYSTEM FOR MEMBERS OF THE SHOALWATER BAY INDIAN TRIBE. CURRENT CONDITIONS AND EXPANDING DROUGHT STRESS IN THE REGION INTENSIFY THE NEED TO MAKE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY SYSTEM ABLE TO WITHSTAND THE FUTURE CONDITIONS EMINENT. DROUGHT STRESS, FIRE DANGER, AQUIFER RECHARGE CONCERNS, EXCESSIVE STORMS, SUBSTANTIAL PERIODS OF HIGH HEAT AND A SMALL RURAL SERVICE AREA IMPACTED HEAVILY BY WATER SHORTAGES, ALL COMBINE TO MAKE THIS A TRIBAL COMMUNITY PRIORITY. PAST WATER SYSTEM ISSUES HAVE LEFT THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY AND BUSINESSES WITHOUT WATER FOR DAYS, RELYING ON DELIVERED WATER AND FIRE TRUCKS TO PROVIDE FOR FLUSHING THE SYSTEM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:WATER SYSTEM MAPPING: THE      NATURAL RESOURCE DEPARTMENT WILL UPDATE A DATABASE COMPRISED OF ALL ACTIVE      AND ABANDONED WATER MAIN LINES, SERVICE LINES, PVC LINE SIZES, METERS,      ELBOWS, VALVES, ELECTRICAL SERVICE LINES, HYDRANTS ETC. THE OUTPUT AND      PROVIDED DOCUMENTATION OF POINTS, LINES AND SHAPE FILES WILL BE UTILIZED      IN GIS TO BE ABLE TO VISUALIZE THE ENTIRETY OF THE SYSTEM AND PROVIDE FOR      FUTURE NEEDS TO THE SYSTEM. SECURING WATER SOURCES:      SEVERAL WELLS ON SHOALWATER BAY INDIAN LANDS HAVE INADEQUATE PROTECTIONS      AROUND THEM. TO BE IN REGULATORY COMPLIANCE FOR USE AS WELL AS TO SECURE      THE SYSTEM FOR FUTURE USE, THE NATURAL RESOURCE DEPARTMENT WILL FENCE EACH      WELL WITH SECURITY FENCING, PLACE CONCRETE BASE AROUND THE WELL HEADS, AND      A PROTECTIVE BUILDING WITH A REMOVABLE ROOF TO ACCESS THE WELLS. WATER STORAGE TANK: THE      WATER TANK THAT PROVIDES WATER TO ALL TRIBAL BUSINESSES, HOUSEHOLDS AND      GOVERNMENT OFFICES, HAS NOT BEEN INSPECTED OR CLEANED IN RECENT TIMES. THE      NATURAL RESOURCE DEPARTMENT WILL HIRE A DIVER TO INSPECT AND CLEAN THE      TANK AND INSTRUCT THE TRIBE IF REPAIRS ARE NECESSARY.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL:INVESTIGATE, PLAN, AND HAVE A COMPLETE WATER RESOURCE SYSTEM INVENTORY THROUGH MAPPING.SAFEGUARDING WHERE THE WATER IS STORED WILL BE ADDRESSED THROUGH THE INSPECTION AND CLEANING OF THE TOWER THAT PROVIDES WATER TO THE TRIBE.SECURE THE TRIBE'S SOURCES OF WATER THROUGH THE PROTECTION OF 5 WELL SITES.THIS WORK WOULD BE CARRIED OUT DURING JULY 1, 2022, WITH A COMPLETION DATE OF JUNE 30, 2024.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRIBAL STAFF WITH BROADER KNOWLEDGE PRODUCED BY MAPPING WATER SYSTEMS, SECURING WATER SOURCES, AND INSPECTING CURRENT INFRASTRUCTURE THAT WILL PROVIDE INFINITE KNOWLEDGE TO UTILIZE AND THE ABILITY TO PROACTIVELY PLAN FOR FUTURE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. PRIORITIZING THE EXPECTED PROJECTS WILL ASSIST IN SECURING THE WATER SYSTEM FOR THE FUTURE, ENABLING COMMUNITY HEALTH TO FLOURISH EVEN IN THE FACE OF UNPRECEDENTED DROUGHT AND CLIMATOLOGICAL IMPACTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A
